result.execSummary:
The defendant Trent Nathanial Thayer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary. Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary. Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol. Make an effort to obtain driver license

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol.  Maintain employment or schooling, make an effort to get a driver license. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $1000 set with conditions of cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license or without valid insurance.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant to sign bond on July 6, 2022 between 12:00-1:00pm. Defendant pleads not guilty, jury trial to be set.
